snippet: The United Nations and the international community have a responsibility to meet the crisis head-on. There are pledges to fulfill, dollars to deliver and lives to save.
abstract: Editorial submits that the United Nations and the international community have a responsibility to meet the cholera crisis in Haiti, which began in late 2010, head-on; contends that the UN is particularly responsible, given that its peacekeepers introduced the disease to the country.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations and the international community have a responsibility to meet the crisis head-on. There are pledges to fulfill, dollars to deliver and lives to save.
